name: Avoid using break or continue statements in loops with high cyclomatic complexity (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all artifacts containing break or continue statements in loops with high cyclomatic complexity. Artifacts considered for this quality rule are PHP Section, method, function and constructor.
output:
This report lists all artifacts containing break or continue statements in loops with high cyclomatic complexity.

This QR provides the following information:
Artifact full name
rationale: Using break or continue statements in loops with high cyclomatic complexity makes code unreadable and difficult to maintain.
remediation: Remove break or continue statements and use loop condition or reduce cyclomatic complexity of the loop.

qualityStandards.name: Callable and Method Control Element Excessive Cyclomatic Complexity Value
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid overly complex control flow

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of structured programming degrades comprehensibility

Measure Element
Number of instances where a named callable control element or method control element has a control flow with a Cyclomatic Complexity number that exceeds a threshold value. Default threshold value for Cyclomatic Complexity is 20
